article.headline: Lehigh 63, Lafayette 55
article.story: BETHLEHEM, Pa. (AP) -- Joe Knight scored 11 points, including a go-ahead 3-pointer with three minutes to go, to lead Lehigh to a 63-55 comeback win over Lafayette on Wednesday night. Jose Olivero led all scorers with 15 points for Lehigh (8-7, 2-0 Patriot League) and Jason Mgebroff added 13 and Nick Monserez 10. Marcus Harley led Lafayette (5-9, 1-1) with 12 points and Jamaal Douglas chipped in seven points and grabbed 12 rebounds. Lafayette, trailing 33-23 at the half, edged slowly to a four-point lead with 6:14 to go, but Knight knocked down a pair of free throws and then nailed a 3-pointer to give Lehigh a 54-53 lead. After a foul shot by Knight and a jumper by Kevin Tempest made the score 59-53 with 28 seconds left, Monserez sealed the game for the Mountain Hawks with a pair of defensive rebounds and 4-for-4 shooting from the foul line. Lehigh led by as much as 16 points early in the second half, but the Leopards went on a 21-4 run to take a 46-45 lead with 9:43 to go on jumper by Douglas.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
